assessment_criteria.question: Do you scan endpoint agent code daily with SAST, dependency scanners, and binary analysis for vulnerabilities?
verification: Review agent code scanning (SAST for source code vulnerabilities, dependency scanners for vulnerable libraries, binary analysis for compiled agents)
Check scanning frequency (daily scans of agent codebase, pre-release validation before agent updates)
Verify vulnerability detection (identify code vulnerabilities, vulnerable dependencies, insecure configurations in agent code)
Confirm scan coverage (agent binaries, all dependencies, third-party libraries, agent configuration files)
Review vulnerability tracking (all agent vulnerabilities tracked, assigned to developers, resolution deadlines)
evidence: Agent code scanning configuration (SAST tools, dependency scanners, binary analysis)
Scanning frequency (daily scans, pre-release scans)
Vulnerability detection results (code issues, vulnerable dependencies)
Scan coverage (binaries, dependencies, libraries, configs)
Vulnerability tracking system (issue tracking, assignment, deadlines)

scoring.yes_if: Daily agent code scanning (SAST, dependency, binary), pre-release validation, comprehensive coverage (binaries, dependencies, libraries), vulnerability tracking with assignments
scoring.partial_if: Weekly scanning or limited tools (SAST only) or no pre-release validation
scoring.no_if: No agent code scanning or manual scanning only or no vulnerability tracking

assessment_criteria.question: Do you manage agent updates with staged rollout (≤10% canary), automated rollback, and critical ≤24h/high ≤7d SLAs?
verification: Review staged rollout process (canary deployment: ≤10% → 50% → 100%, monitor health at each stage)
Check automated rollback (rollback triggered if failure rate >5%, health checks fail, or performance degrades)
Verify agent vulnerability SLAs (critical agent vulnerabilities patched ≤24 hours, high ≤7 days)
Confirm update validation (health checks post-update: agent running, detection working, resource usage normal)
Review SLA compliance (≥95% of agent vulnerabilities remediated within SLA)
evidence: Staged rollout configuration (≤10% canary, 50%, 100% stages)
Automated rollback implementation (failure triggers: >5% failure, health checks, performance)
Agent vulnerability SLA policy (critical ≤24h, high ≤7d)
Post-update validation (health checks implemented)
SLA compliance metrics (≥95% agent vulnerabilities remediated within SLA)

scoring.yes_if: Staged rollout (≤10% canary), automated rollback (failure >5%), critical ≤24h and high ≤7d SLAs, health checks, ≥95% SLA compliance
scoring.partial_if: Staged rollout but manual rollback or SLAs not consistently met (<90% compliance)
scoring.no_if: No staged rollout or no rollback or critical >48h or <85% SLA compliance

assessment_criteria.question: Do you scan endpoint operating systems daily across Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, and Android for missing patches, CVEs, and misconfigurations?
verification: Review OS vulnerability scanning (tools: Qualys, Rapid7, Tenable, Microsoft Defender, platform-specific scanners)
Check platform coverage (Windows 10/11/Server, macOS Ventura/Sonoma, Linux Ubuntu/RHEL/Debian, iOS, Android)
Verify scan coverage (missing OS patches, CVEs, OS misconfigurations, weak settings)
Confirm scanning frequency (daily scans of all endpoints, continuous monitoring)
Review vulnerability reporting (OS vulnerabilities reported to teams, dashboards showing OS patch status)
evidence: OS vulnerability scanning tools (Qualys, Rapid7, Tenable, Defender)
Platform coverage (Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android versions scanned)
Scan coverage (patches, CVEs, misconfigurations detected)
Scanning frequency (daily scans, continuous monitoring)
Vulnerability reporting (dashboards, team notifications)

scoring.yes_if: Daily OS scanning across ≥4 platforms (Windows, macOS, Linux, mobile), comprehensive coverage (patches, CVEs, misconfigs), vulnerability reporting, continuous monitoring
scoring.partial_if: Daily scanning but <4 platforms or limited coverage (patches only) or weekly scanning
scoring.no_if: <3 platforms or no daily scanning or no vulnerability reporting

assessment_criteria.question: Do you scan installed applications for outdated versions, known vulnerabilities, and unsafe configurations?
verification: Review application scanning (browsers, productivity apps, development tools, third-party software)
Check vulnerability detection (outdated versions, known CVEs, unsafe configurations)
Verify application inventory (maintain inventory of installed applications across all endpoints)
Confirm scanning frequency (daily application vulnerability scans)
Review remediation process (outdated apps auto-updated or flagged for manual update, unsafe configs remediated)
evidence: Application scanning configuration (browsers, productivity, dev tools, third-party apps)
Vulnerability detection (outdated versions, CVEs, unsafe configs)
Application inventory (complete inventory of installed apps)
Scanning frequency (daily scans)
Remediation process (auto-update or manual update workflow, config remediation)

scoring.yes_if: Daily application scanning, comprehensive coverage (browsers, productivity, dev tools), vulnerability detection (versions, CVEs, configs), application inventory, remediation process
scoring.partial_if: Weekly scanning or limited app coverage (browsers only) or no inventory
scoring.no_if: No application scanning or no vulnerability detection or no remediation

assessment_criteria.question: Do you scan mobile devices using MDM/MTD for OS version, app vulnerabilities, and jailbreak/root detection?
verification: Review mobile scanning tools (Mobile Device Management: Intune, Jamf; Mobile Threat Defense: Lookout, Zimperium)
Check OS version scanning (detect mobile devices with outdated OS: iOS >1 year old, Android >1 year old)
Verify app vulnerability scanning (detect apps with known vulnerabilities on mobile devices)
Confirm jailbreak/root detection (detect jailbroken iOS, rooted Android devices)
Review mobile remediation (block outdated devices, quarantine jailbroken/rooted devices, force app updates)
evidence: Mobile scanning tools (MDM: Intune/Jamf, MTD: Lookout/Zimperium)
OS version detection (iOS and Android outdated OS detection)
App vulnerability scanning (mobile app CVE detection)
Jailbreak/root detection (iOS jailbreak, Android root detection)
Mobile remediation policy (block outdated, quarantine jailbroken/rooted, force updates)

scoring.yes_if: MDM + MTD scanning, OS version detection (iOS/Android >1 year), app vulnerability scanning, jailbreak/root detection, remediation policy (block/quarantine)
scoring.partial_if: MDM scanning but no MTD or limited detection (OS only) or no remediation
scoring.no_if: No mobile scanning or no jailbreak/root detection or no remediation

assessment_criteria.question: Do you scan endpoint configurations daily for insecure settings (firewall disabled, encryption disabled, weak passwords, unnecessary services) using CIS Benchmarks?
verification: Review configuration scanning (detect firewall disabled, encryption disabled, weak passwords, unnecessary services running)
Check CIS Benchmark compliance (scan against CIS Benchmarks for Windows, macOS, Linux)
Verify scanning frequency (daily configuration scans of all endpoints)
Confirm vulnerability reporting (configuration issues reported, dashboards showing compliance %)
Review auto-remediation (auto-remediate safe config issues: re-enable firewall, disable unnecessary services)
evidence: Configuration scanning coverage (firewall, encryption, passwords, services)
CIS Benchmark scanning (Windows, macOS, Linux CIS compliance)
Scanning frequency (daily scans)
Configuration issue reporting (dashboards, compliance metrics)
Auto-remediation policy (safe config issues auto-remediated)

scoring.yes_if: Daily config scanning, comprehensive coverage (firewall, encryption, passwords, services), CIS Benchmark compliance, issue reporting, auto-remediation (safe issues)
scoring.partial_if: Weekly scanning or limited coverage (firewall + encryption only) or no CIS Benchmarks
scoring.no_if: No config scanning or no CIS Benchmarks or no issue reporting

assessment_criteria.question: Do you conduct weekly privilege escalation checks on high-value endpoints using BeRoot, LinPEAS, or WinPEAS?
verification: Review privilege escalation scanning tools (BeRoot, LinPEAS for Linux, WinPEAS for Windows)
Check scan scope (high-value endpoints: executive laptops, admin workstations, privileged user endpoints)
Verify scanning frequency (weekly privilege escalation scans on high-value endpoints)
Confirm vulnerability detection (detect local privilege escalation vulnerabilities: weak permissions, misconfigured services, kernel exploits)
Review remediation process (privilege escalation vulnerabilities remediated within SLA, compensating controls if patching delayed)
evidence: Privilege escalation scanning tools (BeRoot, LinPEAS, WinPEAS)
High-value endpoint inventory (executives, admins, privileged users)
Scanning frequency (weekly scans of high-value endpoints)
Vulnerability detection results (privilege escalation issues found)
Remediation process (SLA-based remediation, compensating controls)

scoring.yes_if: Weekly privilege escalation scans on high-value endpoints, tools used (BeRoot/LinPEAS/WinPEAS), vulnerability detection, remediation process with SLAs
scoring.partial_if: Monthly scans or limited endpoint coverage (<50% high-value) or no remediation SLAs
scoring.no_if: No privilege escalation scanning or no high-value endpoint targeting

assessment_criteria.question: Do you track cross-platform CVEs and patches across Windows, macOS, Linux, and mobile from official security sources?
verification: Review Windows CVE tracking (sources: Microsoft Security Response Center, Windows Update)
Check macOS CVE tracking (sources: Apple Security Updates)
Verify Linux CVE tracking (sources: Ubuntu Security Advisories, RHEL/Debian security bulletins, distribution package managers)
Confirm mobile CVE tracking (sources: Apple Security Updates, Google Android Security Bulletins)
Review CVE response process (CVEs assessed for applicability, patches deployed within SLA, compensating controls if no patch)
evidence: Windows CVE tracking (MSRC, Windows Update integration)
macOS CVE tracking (Apple Security Updates monitoring)
Linux CVE tracking (Ubuntu/RHEL/Debian security advisories)
Mobile CVE tracking (Apple/Google security bulletins)
CVE response workflow (assessment, patch deployment, compensating controls)

scoring.yes_if: Cross-platform CVE tracking (Windows, macOS, Linux, mobile), official sources monitored (MSRC, Apple, distribution advisories, Google), CVE response process (assessment, patching, compensating controls)
scoring.partial_if: Limited platform coverage (3/4 platforms) or no CVE response process
scoring.no_if: <3 platforms or no official source monitoring or no CVE tracking

assessment_criteria.question: Do you implement automated patch deployment via WSUS, SCCM, Jamf, or Intune with critical auto-deployment and staged rollout for major updates?
verification: Review automated patching tools (WSUS, SCCM for Windows; Jamf for macOS; Intune for cross-platform; apt/yum/dnf for Linux)
Check critical patch auto-deployment (critical patches auto-deployed within SLA: ≤24 hours)
Verify staged rollout for major updates (major OS/app updates: canary 10% → 50% → 100%)
Confirm patch testing (patches tested in staging environment before production deployment)
Review patch failure handling (failed patches retried, escalated if persistent failure)
evidence: Automated patching tools (WSUS, SCCM, Jamf, Intune, Linux package managers)
Critical patch auto-deployment policy (auto-deploy critical ≤24h)
Staged rollout configuration (major updates: 10% → 50% → 100%)
Patch testing process (staging environment validation)
Patch failure handling (retry, escalation workflow)

scoring.yes_if: Automated patching (WSUS/SCCM/Jamf/Intune), critical auto-deployment (≤24h), staged rollout for major updates, patch testing (staging), failure handling
scoring.partial_if: Automated patching but manual critical patches or no staged rollout or no testing
scoring.no_if: No automated patching or critical >48h or no patch testing

assessment_criteria.question: Do you isolate endpoints with critical unpatched vulnerabilities that are network-facing until patched, with manual override for business-critical systems?
verification: Review endpoint isolation triggers (critical unpatched vulnerability + network-facing endpoint)
Check isolation method (network isolation prevents lateral movement, endpoint quarantined until patched)
Verify manual override process (business-critical systems can request isolation override with approvals)
Confirm isolation monitoring (isolated endpoints tracked, patching prioritized, isolation removed post-patch)
Review isolation effectiveness (isolated endpoints cannot spread malware, critical services maintain limited access)
evidence: Endpoint isolation policy (triggers: critical unpatched + network-facing)
Isolation method (network isolation, quarantine)
Manual override process (business-critical approval workflow)
Isolation tracking (isolated endpoint inventory, patching priority, removal post-patch)
Isolation effectiveness validation (lateral movement prevented, critical services accessible)

scoring.yes_if: Endpoint isolation for critical unpatched + network-facing, network isolation method, manual override (business-critical approval), isolation tracking, effectiveness validated
scoring.partial_if: Isolation policy but manual isolation or no override process or limited tracking
scoring.no_if: No endpoint isolation or critical vulnerabilities unaddressed or no tracking

assessment_criteria.question: Do you implement compensating controls (enhanced monitoring, network restrictions, feature disablement) until permanent remediation, with tracking?
verification: Review compensating controls (enhanced monitoring for vulnerable endpoints, network access restrictions, disable vulnerable features)
Check control implementation (compensating controls deployed within 24 hours of vulnerability identification)
Verify control tracking (all compensating controls documented, tracked until permanent remediation)
Confirm control effectiveness (controls reduce risk while permanent fix pending: monitoring detects exploitation attempts, restrictions limit exposure)
Review control removal (compensating controls removed after permanent patch deployed)
evidence: Compensating controls policy (enhanced monitoring, network restrictions, feature disable)
Control implementation SLA (deployed within 24 hours)
Compensating controls tracking system (documentation, permanent remediation status)
Control effectiveness validation (risk reduction, exploitation detection)
Control removal process (removed post-patch)

scoring.yes_if: Compensating controls implemented (monitoring, restrictions, feature disable), deployed ≤24h, tracked until permanent fix, effectiveness validated, removed post-patch
scoring.partial_if: Compensating controls available but >48h deployment or limited tracking
scoring.no_if: No compensating controls or no tracking or controls not removed post-patch

assessment_criteria.question: Do you implement risk-based prioritization by exploitability × asset criticality with P0-P3 tiers (actively exploited, public exploits, moderate risk, minimal risk)?
verification: Review prioritization framework (Critical/P0: actively exploited + internet-facing/sensitive, High/P1: high CVSS + public exploits + privileged users, Medium/P2: moderate risk + internal + compensating controls, Low/P3: minimal risk + difficult exploit)
Check asset criticality assessment (endpoints categorized: internet-facing, sensitive data, privileged users, standard users)
Verify exploitability assessment (actively exploited, public exploits available, proof-of-concept only, theoretical)
Confirm prioritization automation (vulnerabilities auto-assigned priority based on exploitability + asset criticality)
Review prioritization validation (security team reviews prioritization, adjusts based on business context)
evidence: Risk-based prioritization framework (P0-P3 definitions: exploitability × criticality)
Asset criticality categorization (internet-facing, sensitive, privileged, standard)
Exploitability assessment (actively exploited, public exploits, PoC, theoretical)
Prioritization automation (auto-assignment based on risk factors)
Prioritization validation (security review, business context adjustment)

scoring.yes_if: Risk-based prioritization (exploitability × asset criticality), P0-P3 tiers defined (actively exploited, public exploits, moderate, minimal), asset categorization, exploitability assessment, automation + validation
scoring.partial_if: Prioritization framework but manual prioritization or limited asset categorization
scoring.no_if: No risk-based prioritization or severity-only prioritization or no asset context

assessment_criteria.question: Do you implement remediation SLAs with critical ≤24h, high ≤7d, medium ≤30d, low ≤90d and track SLA compliance?
verification: Review remediation SLA policy (critical ≤24 hours, high ≤7 days, medium ≤30 days, low ≤90 days)
Check SLA tracking (all vulnerabilities tracked from identification to remediation, SLA countdown visible)
Verify SLA compliance (≥95% of vulnerabilities remediated within SLA)
Confirm SLA exceptions (exceptions require approval, documented justification, compensating controls)
Review SLA breach handling (SLA breaches escalated, root cause analysis, improvement actions)
evidence: Remediation SLA policy (critical ≤24h, high ≤7d, medium ≤30d, low ≤90d)
SLA tracking dashboard (vulnerability age, SLA countdown, compliance %)
Current SLA compliance (≥95% remediated within SLA)
SLA exception process (approval, justification, compensating controls)
SLA breach handling (escalation, root cause analysis, improvements)

scoring.yes_if: SLAs defined (critical ≤24h, high ≤7d, medium ≤30d, low ≤90d), SLA tracking (dashboard, countdown), ≥95% compliance, exception process (approval, compensating controls), breach handling
scoring.partial_if: SLAs defined but <90% compliance or no exception process or limited tracking
scoring.no_if: No SLAs or <85% compliance or no SLA tracking

assessment_criteria.question: Do you maintain ≥95% patch compliance within SLA across all endpoints?
verification: Review patch compliance measurement (% endpoints fully patched within SLA for their vulnerabilities)
Check current compliance (≥95% endpoints patched within SLA: critical ≤24h, high ≤7d)
Verify compliance reporting (real-time dashboards showing patch compliance %, trending)
Confirm non-compliance tracking (endpoints not meeting SLA identified, prioritized for remediation)
Review compliance improvement (quarterly reviews of patch compliance, improvement initiatives for <95%)
evidence: Patch compliance measurement methodology (% endpoints patched within SLA)
Current patch compliance (≥95% within SLA)
Compliance dashboards (real-time compliance %, trends)
Non-compliance tracking (endpoints below SLA, remediation priority)
Compliance improvement process (quarterly reviews, improvement initiatives)

scoring.yes_if: ≥95% patch compliance within SLA, real-time dashboards (compliance %, trends), non-compliance tracking, quarterly reviews + improvement initiatives
scoring.partial_if: ≥90% compliance or limited dashboards or no improvement process
scoring.no_if: <90% compliance or no patch tracking or no compliance measurement

assessment_criteria.question: Do you track vulnerability metrics with ≤5% endpoints having critical/high vulnerabilities, MTTR critical ≤24h/high ≤7d, and ≤2% patch failure rate?
verification: Review vulnerable endpoint metric (≤5% endpoints with unpatched critical or high severity vulnerabilities)
Check MTTR (Mean Time to Remediate: critical vulnerabilities ≤24 hours, high vulnerabilities ≤7 days)
Verify patch failure rate (≤2% of patch deployments fail or cause issues)
Confirm metrics tracking (real-time dashboards showing vulnerable endpoint %, MTTR, patch failure rate)
Review metrics improvement (quarterly analysis of metrics, improvement initiatives if targets not met)
evidence: Vulnerable endpoint metric (current: ≤5% with critical/high vulnerabilities)
MTTR tracking (critical ≤24h, high ≤7d)
Patch failure rate (current: ≤2% failure rate)
Metrics dashboards (real-time vulnerable %, MTTR, failure rate)
Metrics improvement process (quarterly analysis, improvement initiatives)

scoring.yes_if: ≤5% vulnerable endpoints (critical/high), MTTR critical ≤24h and high ≤7d, ≤2% patch failure rate, real-time dashboards, quarterly improvement process
scoring.partial_if: ≤10% vulnerable or MTTR critical ≤48h/high ≤14d or ≤5% failure rate, or limited dashboards
scoring.no_if: >10% vulnerable or MTTR critical >48h/high >14d or >5% failure or no metrics tracking

success_metrics.target: ≥95% endpoints patched within SLA (critical ≤24h, high ≤7d, medium ≤30d, low ≤90d)
success_metrics.measurement: Patch compliance % = (Endpoints patched within SLA / Total endpoints with vulnerabilities) × 100

success_metrics.target: 100% endpoints scanned daily for OS, application, and configuration vulnerabilities
success_metrics.validation: Scan reports show 100% endpoint coverage daily

success_metrics.measurement: MTTR = Average time from vulnerability identification to remediation
success_metrics.data_source: Vulnerability management system (identification to remediation timestamps)
success_metrics.baseline: Current MTTR baseline (critical and high separately)
success_metrics.validation: MTTR dashboards show P50, P95 remediation times

success_metrics.target: ≤5% endpoints with unpatched critical or high severity vulnerabilities
success_metrics.measurement: Vulnerable endpoint % = (Endpoints with critical/high vulns / Total endpoints) × 100
success_metrics.validation: Vulnerability dashboards show real-time vulnerable endpoint count

success_metrics.measurement: Failure rate % = (Failed patches / Total patch deployments) × 100
success_metrics.data_source: Patch management systems (WSUS, SCCM, Jamf, Intune)
success_metrics.validation: Patch deployment reports show success/failure rates

success_metrics.target: ≥95% agent vulnerabilities remediated within SLA (critical ≤24h, high ≤7d)
success_metrics.measurement: Agent SLA compliance % = (Agent vulns remediated within SLA / Total agent vulns) × 100
success_metrics.data_source: Agent code scanning, agent update tracking
success_metrics.validation: Agent update tracking shows SLA compliance rate

success_metrics.target: 100% coverage across Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, and Android
success_metrics.frequency: Daily scans, weekly platform coverage reports
success_metrics.validation: Scan reports show 100% coverage for each platform
